segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and I feel bad for her because she has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and her foot is already wet, but she’s just focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool, and I’m worried he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, and it makes me wonder if she even cares about her brother’s safety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting more slippery, and I can’t help but feel sorry for the woman when she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cookie jar is almost empty, and I think the boy is going to regret taking so many.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone steps in before it’s too late and someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems so lost in her own world, and it’s heartbreaking to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
